Format_Notes: Format: UUID or YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-SEQUENTIAL. Example: '20251202-143045-001'.
Identifies which job/WO was affected by downtime. Multiple downtime entries can exist for same WO.
Ensures data isolation per client.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2025-12-02.

Suggested_Format: Which shift the downtime occurred in
Format_Notes: Allowed values: SHIFT_1ST (7am-5pm), SHIFT_2ND (9pm-6am), SAT_OT (7am-3pm), SUN_OT (7am-3pm), OTHER.
Allowed values: EQUIPMENT_FAILURE, MATERIAL_SHORTAGE, CHANGEOVER_SETUP, LACK_OF_ORDERS, MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULED, QC_HOLD, MISSING_SPECIFICATION, OTHER. Supervisors select from dropdown.
Free text up to 500 chars. Examples: 'Sewing machine needle jammed', 'Fabric supplier delivery delayed', 'Waiting for Engineering specs'.
Positive integer >= 1. Examples: 30 (0.5 hrs), 60 (1 hr), 120 (2 hrs). Converted to hours in calculations (divide by 60).

Suggested_Format: Start time of downtime (if capturing hourly detail)
Format_Notes: HH:MM format (24-hour). Examples: 07:30, 14:15. Optional but encouraged for hourly tracking. Paired with downtime_duration_minutes to calculate end_time.

Suggested_Format: Employee ID of person responsible for reporting/managing downtime (usually supervisor)
Format_Notes: Foreign key to EMPLOYEE table. Used for escalation and accountability.

Suggested_Format: User ID (data collector) who recorded this downtime entry
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Audit trail.

Suggested_Format: When this downtime was reported/logged in system
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). May differ from downtime_start_time if reported after-the-fact (typical end-of-shift entry).
TRUE or FALSE. Default: TRUE (downtime is over). Set to FALSE if ongoing/not yet resolved. Ongoing downtimes flag for escalation.
Free text up to 300 chars. Examples: 'Machine repaired by maintenance at 14:45', 'Material arrived and production resumed', 'Engineering provided spec, restarted at 15:20'.
Estimated hours of WIP held up due to this downtime
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal hours. Auto-calculated as: downtime_duration_minutes/60 * employees_on_line. Useful for impact analysis.

Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).

Suggested_Format: System-generated unique ID for hold/resume event
Format_Notes: Format: UUID or YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS-SEQUENTIAL. Example: '20251202-095030-001'.
Identifies which WO/job was placed on hold.

Suggested_Format: Foreign key to JOB table (optional, if tracking hold by individual job)
Format_Notes: If WO has multiple jobs and you want to hold specific job only, reference job_id.
Ensures data isolation.
Allowed values: ON_HOLD, RESUMED, CANCELLED. ON_HOLD = WIP aging clock paused. RESUMED = clock resumes. CANCELLED = hold never executed.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. REQUIRED if hold_status = ON_HOLD or RESUMED. Example: 2025-12-02.

Suggested_Format: Time hold was initiated (for hourly tracking)
Format_Notes: HH:MM format (24-hour). Optional but encouraged. Example: 14:30.

Suggested_Format: Why material was placed on hold (standardized list)
Format_Notes: Allowed values: MATERIAL_INSPECTION, QUALITY_ISSUE, ENGINEERING_REVIEW, CUSTOMER_REQUEST, MISSING_SPECIFICATION, EQUIPMENT_UNAVAILABLE, CAPACITY_CONSTRAINT, OTHER.
Free text up to 500 chars. Examples: 'Pending fabric color match approval', 'QC found stitching defects, rework required', 'Waiting for customer approval on design change'.

Suggested_Format: User ID (leader/supervisor) who approved the hold
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Required for identification/escalation, not enforcement of actual approval. Identifies accountable party.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC). Documents when decision was made.

Suggested_Format: Date material was resumed to production
Format_Notes: ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD. REQUIRED if hold_status = RESUMED. If null and hold_status = ON_HOLD, job still on hold.

Suggested_Format: Time material was resumed (for hourly tracking)
Format_Notes: HH:MM format. Example: 16:45.

Suggested_Format: User ID who approved resume (may differ from hold approver)
Format_Notes: Foreign key to USER table. Optional if same person. Documents who cleared hold.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
Total hold duration in hours (auto-calculated)
Quality_Level_[YOU_FILL_IN]: Decimal hours. Auto-calculated as: (resume_date - hold_date) in days * 24 + hour difference. Null if hold_status = ON_HOLD (not yet resumed). Used for WIP aging adjustments.

Format_Notes: Free text up to 500 chars. Examples: 'Expected to clear by 2025-12-05', 'Escalated to engineering for expedited review', 'Customer will confirm by EOD'.
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
ISO 8601: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC).
